page.title: 14Decca Navigation Station
page.content: The Decca Navigation Station was built about 34 years ago in 1951.There are four stations like it in Ireland and sixteen in Britain. Locally it is called the rader station but it is not rader.It transmits a radio signal of very long waves. Ships collect the signal,they also collect signals from two other stations like it. It needs all of these signals to point out its precise position. Aeroplanes can not use the system because they fly too fast. The transmitter gets its power from electricty. If this fails Two diesel generators take over. The three aerials each 51\ m (168 ft) are that tall so that the signal can get far out to the sea. Jason King.{
